intro: Corydalis cofouensis, commonly known as the Yunnan corydalis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically range in color from pink to purple. The plant features slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often clustered at the base. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
